title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Currently, I am Ph.D. Student in Political Science of the Graduate Research Group Resilient Institutions at the University of Mainz.
I receive a scholarship founded by the Gutenberg Council for Young Researchers.
In my dissertation project on Sequences of democratic erosion – agents, opportunity structures, and patterns of autocratization under the supervision of Claudia Landwehr, I am aiming to contribute to the debate on democratic resilience.
I hold a B.A. and an M.A. in Political and Social Sciences from the University of Würzburg.

title: Kevin Walz
text:
I am a Ph.D. student of the interdisciplinary Graduate Research Group Resilient Institutions at the University of Mainz.
My research interests cluster around means of comparative politics and especially democracy research. In particular, I am engaged in issues of comparative regime research, democratic legitimacy and deficit, the transformation of political systems, and democratic resilience.
You can find my full CV here.

title: Teaching
text:
I love teaching since my first tutorials as a Teaching Assistant at the University of Würzburg during my Master’s program. For the present and the future, I pursue the claim to offer research-oriented and innovative teaching and thereby sustainably attract students to subjects related to democracy research.

Teaching Assignments

Winter 2022/23: Theory and empiricism of democratic erosion, Advanced module course on democratic erosion (B.A. & M.Ed.), University of Mainz



Tutorials as a Teaching Assistant

2018 – 2020: Introduction to Political Philosophy, University of Würzburg
2018 – 2020: Introduction to Comparative Politics, University of Würzburg
2018 – 2020: Introduction to the Political System of the FRG, University of Würzburg
